intro: Didymoglossum fructuosum, commonly known as the fruiting didymoglossum, is a small, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae, or sedge family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, three-lobed flowers that are often green or brown in color. It typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor soils in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Didymoglossum fructuosum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in environments with consistent moisture.
